item.title: How to zip a directory in Linux
item.description: Sooner or later you may need to zip up a folder - otherwise known a directory - on your linux machine. The code is needed is pretty simple: zip [option] your_new_file.zip the_folder_to_zip So a real-world example of the above logic might be something like this: zip -r html_files.zip html We’re passing the -r option which simply stands for “recursive”. This means that the zip command will continue beyond the specified folder(s) and zip anything inside those folder also.
